unnormalised: Okay, so what’s up with this whole urban gym culture thing these days? Seriously, every time I open Instagram, someone from my office is posting a sweaty selfie from Cult.Fit or some fancy new gym in Bandra. Has everyone suddenly become obsessed with getting ripped like Hrithik Roshan in Dhoom 2?
normalised: Okay, so what is up with this whole urban gym culture thing these days? Seriously, every time I open Instagram, someone from my office is posting a sweaty selfie from Cult.Fit or some fancy new gym in Bandra. Has everyone suddenly become obsessed with getting ripped like Hrithik Roshan in Dhoom two?

unnormalised: I mean, I get it. We're all desk-bound during the day, fueled by chai and samosas, and probably dreaming of escaping the Mumbai traffic. Joining a gym seems like the perfect antidote, right? Plus, the sense of community seems cool. I see my cousin, Priya, is now a regular at this Pilates studio in Delhi, posting about her "fit fam" and achieving her "core goals."
normalised: I mean, I get it. We are all desk-bound during the day, fueled by chai and samosas, and probably dreaming of escaping the Mumbai traffic. Joining a gym seems like the perfect antidote, right? Plus, the sense of community seems cool. I see my cousin, Priya, is now a regular at this Pilates studio in Delhi, posting about her "fit fam" and achieving her "core goals."

unnormalised: But is it sustainable? Are we all going to be hitting the gym five times a week in ten years? Or is this just another fleeting trend, like that time everyone was obsessed with Zumba? I’m honestly wondering if skipping the gym and going for a brisk walk around Marine Drive after work isn't just as effective (and a LOT cheaper!).
normalised: But is it sustainable? Are we all going to be hitting the gym five times a week in ten years? Or is this just another fleeting trend, like that time everyone was obsessed with Zumba? I am honestly wondering if skipping the gym and going for a brisk walk around Marine Drive after work is not just as effective (and a lot cheaper!).

unnormalised: Anyone else feeling this internal debate? What are your thoughts on the rise of urban gym culture in India? Are you part of it, or are you sticking to your good old yoga sessions in your living room while listening to bhajans? Tell me in the comments. Maybe I'll get motivated to finally ditch the extra 5 kgs I’ve been carrying since Diwali!
